newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi readies transport for haj pilgrimage.
newsitem.headline: Saudi readies transport for haj pilgrimage.

text.p: Saudi Arabia is preparing a large-scale transport plan to cope with an estimated two million Moslem pilgrims expected to perform this year's haj in April, the daily Saudi Gazette said on Saturday.
"Pilgrims are expected to spend an estimated 400 million riyals ($106 million) for their transport between cities and the holy sites," the daily said.
"More than 12,000 buses with an estimated seating capacity of 552,000 will be deployed for this year's haj," it said.

About two million Moslams -- half of them from abroad -- are expected to perform this year's haj pilgrimage at Mecca and Medina, site of Islam's two holiest shrines. Moslems are obliged to perform the pilgrimage at least once in their lives if they are able and can afford the cost.
The number of pilgrims is governed by quotas agreed by the Organisation of the Islamic Conference which sets them in relation to each country's population.
